How does it impact response times, accuracy, and false positives in real-world scenarios like ransomware campaigns? Support with examples from Recorded Future case studies.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence Platforms. Topic: Recorded Future (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 011_Threat Hunting > 011_004_Threat Hunting Tools and Technologies > Threat Intelligence Platforms > Recorded Future). Use the provided research context, complete truncated sections (e.g., Autonomous Threat Operations: automates threat prioritization, enrichment, and response; Insikt Group: research arm; Connect API: 100+ integrations), voter suggestions (add case studies like ransomware hunts, link to IOCs/TTPs), and pedagogical elements below. **Learning Objectives:** [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] **Active Learning:** [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] – Tie flashcards to these for active recall. **Scaffolding Layers:** [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] – Distribute cards across layers. **Flashcard Schema & Distractor Protocol:** [INSERT FULL SCHEMA FROM ABOVE] – STRICTLY FOLLOW OUTPUT FORMAT. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards optimized for Anki/Quizlet. Ensure university-level pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition, scaffolding from foundation to integration. Incorporate real-world context (e.g., dark web monitoring, SIEM integration). Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'Q&A| Cloze|MCQ', 'bloom_level': 'REMEMBER', 'layer': 1, 'front': {...}, 'back': {...}, 'tags': ['recordedfuture', 'threathunting']}, ...]. Make explanations educational, referencing objectives/activities.
